references.A88TRO01USGP: Trombulak, S. C. 1988. Mammalian Species No. 322: Spermophilus saturatus.  Pp. 1-4.
references.W15NAT01USGP: NatureServe. 2015. NatureServe Explorer: An online encyclopedia of life [web application]. Version 7.1. NatureServe, Arlington, Virginia. Available http://www.natureserve.org/explorer.

habitat_description: The Cascade Golden-mantled Ground Squirrel (Callospermophilus saturatus) is common on eastern slopes of the cascades from alpine to yellow pine zones but uncommon on the western slope (Trombulak 1988).  It will inhabit closed-coniferous forests, meadows, sagebrush, open meadows, and clearcuts and prefers krummholz in alpine areas, especially with >75% talus (Trombulak 1988, NatureServe 2015).  They may avoid open areas away from cover (trees and logs) at some elevations (Trombulak 1988). N. Tarr, 2/9/2015.
